She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia. She will use it to purchase more soft drinks, hair grease, biscuits and sardines for the business. Her dreams are to educate her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, hair grease, biscuits and sardines for the business.

loans.name: Ra'eda

texts.en:
Ra’eda is a 39-year-old married woman.  She has seven children, five of them attending the primary school.

With this big family, in 2009 she thought she should do something to contribute to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family.

And from 2009 until now, she has been sewing women’s clothes, especially the large ones. Her goods are customized according to her client.

Her dream is to open a business with a large number of employees working for her, to give them the opportunity to work and get income. 

Ra’eda asking Ryada for this loan to buy fabric and threads.  She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en:
Hadeel is a 23-year-old single lady from Jenin city. She lives with her parents in a simple house. 

Hadeel's father is a worker with a very low wage. Hadeel finished her studies in the university and now works with her mother making handmade gifts and doing traditional sewing. She makes very good quality gifts and she would like to market them in the city and outside Palestine. She would like to buy a laptop and create a page on the social networks like Facebook to show her products and sell them.

Hadeel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a laptop to sell her products online. This will increase the demand on her products and also her income. Hadeel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to sell her products online.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is aged 38. She is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her first loan with the BRAC. She is a new member, but she has agreed with the terms and condition of BRAC.

She belongs to an ultra-poor family, and it is very difficult for her to pay all the household expenses with the low income. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been running his business for many years, his shop situated near his home. The reason for their poverty is the selection of a low turn-over business.

Her husband had to spend his savings because of an accident, and now he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods. Therefore, Ghazala requested a loan for passing along to her husband, so that he could buy scrap iron, re-establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. Ghazala is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take a huge loan, after this loan. She says "thank you," to the Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Fatmata, from Tombo, in the Western Area Rural District, near Freetown. She is married and has three children, aged 5 to 14 years. Two of her children are going to school. After the war, Fatmata established her wax print cotton business. She began her business because she was a housewife, but she needed to create income to support the household. She works at the business 10 hours per day, and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of enough capital to run her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more wax print cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Fatmata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax print cotton for resale.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 40-year-old, married man, from a small village near Jenin. He is the father of one son and three daughters. For the past two years, Iyad has been working in a small chicken farm. He buys chicks to raise and sells them in the market. It is a good business, and Iyad has a good experience in this field.

Iyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicks to raise, on his farm. This will improve his farm and also his productivity. 
Iyad appears in the photo, in his farm.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise, at his farm

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu is 38 years old.  She is married with 2 children, who are 5 and 17 years old. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She started this business because she wants to be independent.  

Rugiatu has been in this business since 2008. She sells glasses, cups, knives, and food containers in her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is improper business location.

Rugiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 25 years old. He is a single man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents in a very simple house in the city. For the past few years, Khaled has been working in a store where he sells coal. It is a good business and it is the only one in his area. Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more coal for his store to resell. This will increase his income especially for the winter season. Khaled would like to take a bigger loan in the future to expand his store. Khaled appears in the photo in his coal store.

loans.use: to buy more coal for his store to resell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is 31 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is single and has three children between 2 and 15 years old. For the past three years, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She likes the way people respond to her business. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her restaurant business,

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 41-year-old married man from Deir El Balah. He lives with his wife in a simple house in the city. For the past ten years, Osama has been working on his farm where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables. He sells them to the local traders.
 
Osama took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seeds and seedlings and also renew his irrigation system by buying water pipes. This will improve Osama's farm and also his income. 

Osama appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings and also renew his irrigation system by buying water pipes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 19 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is single and a 10th grade dropout. Over the past four years, she been selling door locks, nails, door catches, etc. in the local market. One problem she facing is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase door locks, nails, door catches, etc. for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase door locks, nails, door catches, etc. for her  business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 65 years old and widowed with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Angelina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chichiko

texts.en:
Chichiko is from the village of Gormaghali. He is 42 years old, married, and has five underage children. Four of his children go to school, and the youngest is an infant.  Chichiko’s spouse gets small-sized social assistance payment (approximately $150 per month) from the government, because she is a mother of a large family.  Chichiko has only seasonal income, from agricultural activities. He owns a cornfield, a nut garden, and grows piglets, but still his earnings are too small. There is hardly enough to cover the cost of food for his family members.

That is the reason why Chichiko decided to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business. Chichiko’s wife will produce cheese, for selling as well as family consuming. This loan will be a great support for Chichiko’s children, as it will generate food and income for their well-being. Chichiko hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start a dairy products business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 39-year-old, married man, from Rafah city. He is a father for three sons and two daughters. All of them are under 18 years old. For the past few years, Ahmad has been making Arabic sweets in his home and selling them, upon request. It is a good business, which needs few machines and materials. Ahmad would like to develop his business, to meet the customers' demand.
 
Ahmad took a USD, Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a bigger oven for his work. This will increase his productivity and also his income. Ahmad dreams of taking a bigger loan in the future, and opening a sweets factory. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a bigger oven for his work

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 32 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Previously she had a loan of KES 50,000 which she repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo, Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with 1 child age 6 years. Her child is going to school. After the war, Kadiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more plates and rubber bowls. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and save some money to attend a vocational school. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plates and rubber bowls.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 47 years old and married. She has three children. She runs a domestic products sales business in Tombo, a town in the Western Area Rural District, in Sierra Leone. She started this business, because she wanted to take care of her family's welfare.

She's been in this business since 1998. She sells goods like glass cups and food containers to her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is an undesirable business location.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone. She will use the loan to purchase more spoons, and a variety of food containers, for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons, and a variety of food containers, for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 23-year-old woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, cooking oil and other household items. She also sells some clothes outside her shop. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Her business is located in an area smart for the business, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough money. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other household items. Her business goal is to open a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed in business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other household items.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a 27-year-old married man. He has one child who is 3 months old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area favorable for the business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather which affects his business, especially during the rainy season. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to become a taxi operator within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will earn high returns. This is Kyalo's second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Momen

texts.en:
Momen is a 27-year-old, single man from Nablus city. For the past few years, Momen has been making different kinds of sweets in his home and selling them, upon request. For example, he makes customized cakes for wedding parties. It is a good business, which needs few machines and materials. Momen would like to develop his business, to meet the customer demand.
 
Momen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a bigger oven for his work. This will increase his productivity and also his income. 

Momen dreams of taking a bigger loan in the future and opening a sweets factory. Momen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a bigger oven for his work

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Annie from Liberia. She lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single and has four children between the ages of 16 and 30 years old. Only one of them still lives at home and attends school. 

Annie attended school and stopped in the 5th grade, but she is good at managing her business. For the past three years she has been selling red oil in the local market. Now she faces no problems as she sells every day, spending 10 hours each day on her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 42-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a carpentry business, where he makes chairs, tables, stools, and other furniture to sell. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are of all kinds. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add stock of timber, nails, and other materials for making new furniture. His business goal is to own a big workshop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP - DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of wood, nails, and other materials

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a 42-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be devoted. He operates a retail store where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an area with lots of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price inflation. 

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy leather to make shoes. His business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 30-year-old married man. He has one child who is one and a half years old. He describes himself to be an innovative and business-minded person. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local travelers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be climate changes and insecurity. He wants to venture into agriculture and has taken a loan of KES 20,0000 to buy pigs to raise. His business goal is to expand and buy a bus for transport services within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be a great farmer. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old and married with four children between 3 and 18 years old. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo, in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. Three of her children are going to school.

She's been in this business since she got married and sells spoons, knives and food containers in her community.  She says that the main problems for her business are the limited purchasing power of her customers and completion in the market.

Nancy requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more bowls and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 38-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and lives with her husband and parents. She is a housewife and looks after her family members. 

Her husband provides transportation services to passengers with his auto rickshaw. He has been driving the rickshaw for many years. During this tenure, most of the important parts such as pistons, tires, and the front mirror have been deteriorating and the wheels need alignment. 
 
Her husband feels tranquil and comfortable because he knows that BRAC Pakistan provides loans with easy terms and conditions. She hopes that with this cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time.

Jamila requested a loan from Kiva for her husband to buy spare parts for the vehicle, such as tires, pistons, headlights, front mirror, and tubes and to pay for the alignment of the wheels.

loans.use: to maintain an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a charcoal business in Tombo in the Western rural area of Freetown. She started her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.  

She's been in this business since she got married, and she sells charcoal at her house.  She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, she would like to change her business to a food stand store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Mabinty from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children, age 2 years and 7 years. One of her children is going to school. After the war, Mabinty established her rubber slippers business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week, moving around the community to establish her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy more rubber slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future; Mabinty plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber slippers for resale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 26-year-old married man. He has a child who is one year old. He describes himself to be faithful, patient and God-fearing. 

He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for one and a half years. His primary customers are local travelers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity and harassment by police. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. 

His business goal is to buy a taxi within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. Previously he was selling secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Maundu

texts.en: Maundu is a 67-year-old married man. He has seven children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, cooking oil, bread and other household goods. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his stock of sugar, flour, bread, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to support his family comfortably.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, bread, cooking oil and other items to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elena works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell through her vegetable vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 40 years old and married. She has three children, ages 3 to 10 years. She runs a retail business in Tombo, a town of the Western Area Rural District in Sierra Leone. She started her business to earn income to support her family. 

She's been in business since just after she got married. She sells palm oil, foofoo (cassava grain), and groundnuts, in her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well. Out of the profit she has been able to take of her family.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone. She will use it to purchase more palm oil, groundnuts and foofoo (cassava grain), for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, groundnuts and foofoo (cassava grain), for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is in her early thirties and married, with three children between 1 year and 14 years. She runs a cosmetics business in Tombo, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She began her business because she wants to strive for her daily bread.

She has been in this business since after the rebel war and sells earrings, chains, and bags within a busy market area.  She says that the main problem for her business is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy cosmetics and earrings, chains, and bags for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to expand her cosmetics table more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and earrings, chains, and bags for resale.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида родилась в 1993 года. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Фарида окончила школу с хорошими оценками. Данное время она является студенткой 3 курса Медицинского Колледжа. Фарида успешно учится в колледже. В свободное время читает разные книги, а также после занятий она помогает маме по домохозяйству. Фарида мечтает быть хорошим медиком после окончания колледжа, но зарплата родителей не хватает для оплаты ее учебы в колледже в этом году. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farida was born in 1993.  She is a very smart and hardworking young woman.  She finished high school with high marks.  At the moment, she is a third year student at the College of Medicine.  She is successful in her studies there.  In her free time, she likes to read and she also helps her mother run their household.  Farida dreams of becoming a good physician after finishing college but her parents' income isn't enough to pay for her tuition this year.  She is asking for a loan to help pay for her education.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her education

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 22 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is living together with her spouse and two-year-old child. She stopped her education at seventh grade, but she sells hardware like door locks, hinges, nails, and door handles, which she manages well. She has sold these goods for the past eight years, without encountering any problem. Her mother assisted with some funds, which Victoria used to start her business.

She is asking for a loan. She will use it to buy more door locks, hinges, nails, and door handles for her business, in order to have some sustainable, future plan.

loans.use: to buy more door locks, hinges, nails, and door handles for her business

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 54-year old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She belongs to a happy family because her son earns sufficient income to meet daily household expenses. 

Her son has been running a generator-repair workshop for many years in a nearby town. He is very professional and experienced in his work. As we know, there are lots of problems due to load shedding of electricity, so most of the people like to use a generator to generate the electricity. Due to heavy usage, most of its parts become out of order. This is the reason her son has so many customers for generator repairing. 

Her son is very hard-working and honest; he asks very low services charges against his services. That is why people like to repair their generators from him. 

Her son wants to buy spare parts for generators and tools for generator repair, but he does not have sufficient savings to spend for purchases because recently he spent his savings for an emergency need.

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son will be able to buy his desired spare parts and tools for repairing. 

Shehnaz hopes that through all this purchasing, customers will be attracted toward his shop, which would led to an increase in income and savings.

Shehnaz has praises for the lenders and is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools for her son's generator-repair shop.

loans.name: Istat

texts.ru: Истат 27-летняя жительница города Конибодом. Она одна воспитывает двоих детей, так как ее муж находится за пределами страны. Он уехал в Россию на заработки, потому что в родном городе он не нашел подходящую работу. Уже 2 года Истат работает в магазине своей тети и ведет свой торговый бизнес. Она сама привозит товар и сама ее продает. Истат в основном занимается продаже женской одежды и обуви. К приходу зимы Истат готовится тщательно, она берет кредит, чтобы закупить коллекцию осенне-зимней одежды и обуви. Истат знает, как тяжело расти детей в наше время и старается, чтобы у них было все. Она считает, что благополучие ее семьи зависит от ее дохода, поэтому она так усердно трудиться.
texts.en: Istat is a 27-year-old resident of Konibodom.  She is raising two children on her own since her husband isn't in the country.  He is currently a migrant worker in Russia as he was unable to find suitable work in his own area.  Istat has worked for the last two years in her aunt's store.  She buys inventory herself, and then resells it.  Istat mostly focuses on selling women's shoes and clothing.  In preparation for the upcoming winter, Istat is taking out a loan to buy a collection of fall and winter clothing and shoes for women.  She understands how hard it is for children at this time and she tries to give them everything.  She feels that the welfare of her family depends on her income and therefore she works very hard.

loans.use: To buy fall and winter women's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангезу 20 лет. Она великодушная и жизнерадостная девушка. Мехрангез не замужем и живет с родителями. Она студентка 2 курса и учится отлично. Мехрангез активно участвует на семинарах и ее преподаватели довольны ее учебой. Мехрангез верит в светлое будущее и уверена, что после окончания университета она будет работать в банковской структуре, и будет развевать свои навыки и знания. Она из небогатой семьи и поэтому ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Если она не оплатить за учебный договор, ее исключать из университета. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше благородство.
texts.en: Mehrangez is 20 years old.  She is a generous and cheerful young woman.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  She is a second year student and receives top marks.  Mehrangez actively participates in seminars and her professors are happy with her.  She believes in a bright future and is certain that after finishing university, she will work at a banking institution and will expand her skills and knowledge.  She's from a poor family and her parents aren't in a position where they are able to pay her tuition.  She is asking for a loan to pay for her education.  If she doesn't pay what's owed, she will be forced to leave her studies.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 22-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for the past 4 years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to cover the expenses of her family members. She is contributing a lot to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the daily household expenses alone. 

Shazia is a motivated mother of two. She is liable to provide her children with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity for making footballs.

loans.name: Turobjon

texts.ru: Туробжон живет в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ему 53 года. Он женат. Его жена работает на местном рынке, продает яблоки. Дочка предоставляет услуги портнихи. Туробжон сейчас безработный и хочет заняться животноводством. Он закончил постройку коровника во дворе своего дома и надеется содержать там скот. Для осуществления своего намерения Туробжон запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить 7-голов бычков и телят со скотного рынка. Его собственный стартовый капитал составляет 850 долларов США. Туробжон уже составил свой мини бизнес-план. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение одного месяца и затем перепродавать на том же рынке по выгодной цене. Туробжон в данный момент нигде не работает и хочет начать зарабатывать таким образом. Он просит поддержки!
texts.en: Turobjon lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  He is 53 years old and married.  His wife works at a local market selling apples.  His daughter provides services as a dressmaker. Turobjon is currently unemployed and wants to start working with livestock.  He finished construction on a barn in the yard of his home where he will house his animals.  To complete his plans, he is asking for a loan to buy seven bulls and cattle from a livestock market.  His personal start-up capital is 850 USD.  Turobjon already has a mini business plan.  He intends on fattening his animals for one month and then reselling them at the same market at a higher price.  As he is otherwise not working, he wants to start earning a living with this business.  He asks for your support.

loans.use: To buy seven bulls and calves to start a new livestock business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as obedient and patient. She operates a grocery store in which she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of the products. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stock of onions, tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables. Her business goal is to open a cereals store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own property. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of onions, tomatoes, kale, and other vegetables to her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 2 years old. She describes herself to be God-fearing. 

She operates a salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are students and other individual clients. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a new hair dryer and cosmetics. Her business goal is to have multiple businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will send her children to better schools. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a new hair dryer and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 28-year-old married father of three children who has worked as a farmer for ten years. He is a hard worker who puts so much effort to keep on improving his work and develop his family’s socioeconomic situation. 

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a power generator which will help him a lot in his business. His customers are the  wholesale market businessmen. At the beginning of his business long ago, he had problems with the lack in his financial capital, but he endured it and insisted on developing his business forward. 

As for the future, Kassem is willing to support and develop his business through buying new machines to increase his productivity.

loans.use: to buy a power generator which will help him a lot in his business.

loans.name: Yabom

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Yabom from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children between the ages 7 years and 13 years. She started this business to pay for their daily meals with the cooking sales. 

Yabom runs a cookery business at home; she sells prepared food at her house. She has been running this business after the war. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Yabom says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Yabom has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cooking items like rice, palm oil, and cooking seasoning for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 7 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of 2 children and is motivated to provide for her family. Kaneez wants to grow her business and has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy stock of rice and flour, oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good credit behavior in past. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour, oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Kuku

texts.en: Kuku lives in Sinkor, one of the areas where living conditions are similar to those in the center of Monrovia. She is 43 years old and married to a carpenter. They have 7 children between the ages of 6 and 23, and only six are in school and live at home. She was fortunate to complete 12th grade. For 15 years now she has been involved in local soap making. Sometimes her customers buy on credit and don’t pay on time. She learned this trade from a local soap making school. She likes her business because it makes her self-sufficient. She is requesting a loan to purchase caustic, wood, oil, and plastic for her business. Her plan is to build her house and take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase caustic, wood, oil, and plastic for her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married, with three children, with ages ranging from 8 months to 6 years. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a general store where he sells household items. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a relatively good area. He describes his biggest business challenges to be high transport costs and goods. 

Stephen will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of phone chargers, cables, plastic containers, and other household goods for resale. 

His business goal is to have more branches within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a famous businessman. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stocks of phone chargers, cables, plastic containers, and other household goods for resale

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Шамигул из города Вахдат является верной женой, хорошей матерю и начинающей бизнес леди с огромными планами на жизнь. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем, имеет детей. Ее муж работает в лесном хозяйстве в должности главного бухгалтера. Сама Шамигул до сегодняшнего дня нигде не работала. И теперь она начинает собственное дело. Шамигул хочет заняться купле-продажей крупного рогатого скота. Она целеустремленный и в себе уверенный человек. Шамигул во дворе своего дома успела построить коровник из глиняных стен и провести электричество, чтоб зимой животным было тепло и светло. Шамигул учитывает все капризы этой деятельности. Осталось купить корм и 3-х коров для начала бизнеса. По этой причине она просит кредит. Шамигул надеется, что ей помогут купить коров и корм. Она ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en: Shamigul is from the city of Vahdat and is a faithful wife, good mother and beginning business woman with big plans for her life.  She is 48 years old, married and has children.  Her husband works in the forestry sector as a head accountant.  Shamigul herself has not worked up until this point in her life.  Now, she wants to start her own business.  She would like to start buying and selling cattle.  She is a goal-oriented and positive person.  In her yard, Shamigul has built a barn out of mud walls and has supplied it with electricity so the animals will have light and warmth in the winter. She takes into account all the possible unknowns of this business.  All that's left is to buy feed and three cattle to start.  For this reason, she is taking out a loan.  Shamigul hopes that you will help her.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy three head of cattle and feed to start a new business

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 17 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a restaurant where she sells tea, cooked maize, beans, and other foods. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a relatively good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of food. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stock of milk, cooking oil, flour, and other ingredients for making food. Her business goal is to have more branches within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of milk, cooking oil, flour, and other cooking ingredients to her restaurant.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a widow and a farmer mainly dealing in cattle fattening and trade. She started farming in 2006 and has done this to date. Her farm is located on Ibare-Igara-Bushenyi and she started it with a hope of getting a clear source of income so she could sustain herself and the family. With the UGAFODE loan (if given) she would like to buy three cows for milk production so that she increases her sources of income. Her clients are the local people who usually buy the cows and the milk from her. Her hope for the future is becoming financially stable despite the challenge of competition which she is facing at the moment. She also has a produce business in the city which she says has greatly supported her and she believes that with the sources of income she has, she will be able to cater for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is 51 years old. She is from the village of Nigoiti, living with her retired mother.
Mzevinar earns living through skin care business. She is a cosmetologist and produces face creams for resale. She has her regular clients and takes special orders from them. Her earnings are very small, often hardly enough for covering food and daily expenses.
With the requested loan, Mzevinar plans to purchase bee hives with bee colonies and start an apicultural business. The family members will sell the produced honey for a good price and they will increase their family income. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business and Mzevinar will be able to improve her family's living conditions.
She hopes for your favor.

loans.use: to start beekeeping.

loans.name: Kuma

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Kumba from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children, ages 7 years and 14 years. One of her children is going to school. After the war, Kumba established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Kumba requires a loan in order to buy more dresses for females to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Kumba plans on owning a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more dresses for females to expand her business.

loans.name: Masaray

texts.en:
Maseray is in her late twenties and married, with three children between 2 years and 14 years. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She began her business to get her daily bread.

She's been in this business since she left school. She sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Maseray requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to open a big provision shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County. As the capital city of Liberia, it is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 35 year of age, is unmarried, and has two children ages 6 and 11, who are in school and live at home. Over the past 9 years she has been running a shop where she sells bags of charcoal. She started this business with the help of her fiancée and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it gives her profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags charcoal for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia , 36, belongs to the middle standard family, and she is passing her life with her spouse and three daughters happily. Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Sobia's husband earns a sufficient amount to easily afford the household expenses and the school fees of his children. He transports all kinds of goods, clothing and food items from one place to another within the city. He enters into a contract, hires a vehicle according to the volume of goods, and delivers them to their destination.

Recently he got a contract to deliver goods to another city, but he does not have the money to hire a vehicle because of the higher fare demanded. Therefore, Sobia is requesting a loan for that purpose. She is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will support her request.

Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To hire a truck for the transportation of goods.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is in her late thirties and married with 3 children between 8 and 11 years old. She runs a retails business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She began her business to get her daily bread.

She's been in this business since she got married and sells sugar and biscuit within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Emma requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuit for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to become a sole trade distributor. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuit for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children aged one and a half years and 7 years. He describes himself to be patient and honest. He operates a pharmacy where he sells medicine. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a conducive area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to stock up on medicine for resale. His business goal is to start a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will open other businesses for his siblings.

loans.use: stock up on medicine for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 31-year-old single woman; she has one child. She describes herself to be honest and patient. 

Teresia operates a beauty salon, where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located in a residential area, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be electrical interruption. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials to expand her business space (i.e nails, iron sheets, timber). 

Her business goal is to diversify into other businesses within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy materials to expand her business space, i.e nails, iron sheets, timber

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 35-year old married woman, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a hawker and sells fruits in their hometown. He goes daily to a fruit market to buy fresh fruits such as mangoes, bananas, apples etc, and he is very famous in the community due to the freshness of his fruits. He has been selling fruits for many years; because of it he understands the mind and demand of people. Nowadays the demand has been increased. He wants to buy more fruits, and in this way fulfill the demand and easily get more profit.
Therefore, Kishwar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more fruits, especially seasonal fruits like bananas.
This is the second loan for Kishwar; she assured us that she will pay all installments on time as with her previous loan because she wants to take another loan in the future. 
Kishwar is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits to sell.

loans.name: Naveela

texts.en:
Naveela   is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She started her own business of clothing sales four years ago when her husband got severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. 

She buys clothes of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and then sells them in her community at a profit. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She is unable to cover her daily household expenses. Naveela has gradually improved her business and has now requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy a variety of clothes for the winter season in large quantities to add to her current ones. She is in her second loan cycle and counted on as a good client. 

She wishes to use the earned profits for her children’s health and education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for the winter season in large quantities.

loans.name: Gbasshay

texts.en:
Gbasshay is 38 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 12 years. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2012, and sells glass cups, knives and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is an improper business location.

Gbasshay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County. As the capital city of Liberia, it is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. 30-year-old Helen is married to a local businessman. They have two children ages 4 and 10, who are in school and live at home. For the past two years now she has been running a table market where she sells slippers. Helen started this business with the money from her friends and learned this way of selling from them. She likes her business because it makes more profits. She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers for her business. She wants to own a house.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her slipper-selling business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 40 years old, married, and has two children, ages 5 and10. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo's western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She sells palm oil within her community; she started this business after she got married. She says that at present, her business is doing well, because out of the profit she was able to take of her family.

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business, and to have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise lives in Montserrado County. As the capital city of Liberia, it is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 31 years old and single with 4 children between the ages 3 and 15 years old, who are in school and live at home. For the past 4 years now she has been selling used clothes in the community market. She started this business with the help of her boyfriend and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 8 hours each day on her business and she is using a taxi most of the time to get her goods at her table. She described herself as a business-minded woman and likes her business because a give her more profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes to expand her sales. She wants to have more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to expand her sales.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en: Suraya is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of five. She has been running a business with her husband selling milk for the past 15 years. She has two buffaloes and one cow with milk and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Suraya looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and the education of her children. In order to make huge profits, Suraya has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for eight years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread and an electric sewing machine.  

She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She aspires to own a tailoring school and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more  rolls of clothing materials, thread and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 40-year-old man from Suna East in Migori county, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He supports eight people in his family. He is married to Teresia, who is a business lady, and supports the family by providing income. He has six children who are 17, 13, 12, 9, 7 and 2 years old respectively.

He makes bricks for construction, a business he has been doing for the last six years, and gets a monthly income of KES 30,000. He has requested his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to expand his business. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase land for making more bricks.

His dream is to live better and to educate his children.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 53-year-old widow and the mother of three. She is a vigorous lady, and she has been running a business of selling cloths after her husband’s death for the past ten years. 

Naseem buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Naseem is requesting a PKR 25,000 loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

Naseem expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs for resale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 21 years old. He lives in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, so he decided to open a barber shop. Four years ago he got a course in this field. He earns $543 monthly.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a barber chair and redecorate his shop. This will increase the number of clients, and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  

Mohamad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, age 42 is from the village of Akhasheni, Kakheti region. She is married and lives with her two grown children and retired mother-in-law. The family earns a living through agriculture. They grow grapes and strawberries seasonally and sell their harvest to fruit retailers. Besides, Mariam takes care the pig with piglets and a horse, which is used for transportation by her husband. 

Like a majority of middle-aged Georgian women, Mariam stays home in spite of her high education. She is an excellent mother and housewife who tries to give her children all the best. Mariam sorrows that she is not able to generate income in the family that is why she had decided to start her own business and go to capital city fair market to purchase apparel and linens for resale. She will sell the items from her house among her community members. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business and Mariam will be able to continue the business. Mariam believes in your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase apparel and linens for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 40 years old and married with 1 child aged 7 years. She runs a retail shop in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since before she got married and sells glasses, cups, knives, and food containers in her community. She says that the main problem to her business is improper business location.

Alice requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and variety of food containers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with five children and four children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (sister and brother). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She works seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.  She resides in the rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 51-year-old lady from Migori County, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family and is a married lady who has three children and their ages are 17, 15 and 10 years old respectively.

She sells both secondhand and new clothes. She has been selling these for the last 27 years and gets a monthly income of KES 72,000. She has requested her sixth loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase bails of both secondhand and new clothes. She plans to use the anticipated profit in running the business.

Her dream is to prosper in business and life together with her family.

loans.use: To add more stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is a 33-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and four children. She has been in the business of hand embroidery for the past 2 years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, Jameela has requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. Jameela dreams for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Tindewend Group

texts.fr:
Mme RAKIETA représente le groupe TINDEWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant. L’enfant est âgé de 02ans. Personne ne va à l’école.
Mme vend des condiments  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de la cité AN II. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 10  sachets d’ail, 3sachets de lorié,01 sac d’oignon,2paquets de cube Maggi,.. .
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut élargir son commerce. Mme ambitionne assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en: Mrs. Rakieta represents the Tindewende group. She is married and has one child. Her child is two years old. No family members are in school. Rakieta has been selling condiments for six years. She stocks up at the town market of An II. Her customers are women. She would like to buy 10 packs of garlic, three packs of laurel, one bag of onions, two packs of Maggi bouillon [stock] cubes etc. Thanks to her revenues, she would like to expand her business. Her goal is to provide for her child’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 10 packs of garlic, three packs of laurel, one bag of onions, two packs of Maggi bouillon [stock] cubes etc.

loans.name: Savlatbi

texts.ru: Савлатби 13 лет своей жизни провела, занимаясь торговлей детской одежды на центральном рынке района Хамадони. Такой интересной деятельности ее научила подруга, которая до сегодняшних дней занимается торговлей. Одной из главных причин, по которой Савлатби продает детские вещи являются сами дети. Ей нравиться их одеть, обуть и видеть их восторженные лица. Она торгует много лет и собирается остаться в этой сфере работы еще столько же. Для этого ей нужно поскорей привести из города теплые детские вещи. Для закупа товара и на дорогу у нее мало финансов, по этой причине она просит кредит. Это уже ее повторный заем для развития бизнеса. Она ждет Вашей милости!
texts.en: Savlatbi has dedicated 13 years of her life to selling children’s cloithing at the central market of the Hamadoni Region. She learned this interesting line of business from a friend of hers, who still works as a vendor herself. One of the main reasons why Savlatbi sells children’s clothing are the children’s themselves. She likes to find them new outfits and shoes and see their excitement. She has been a vendor for many years and intends to work in this field for many years more. She needs to bring warm children clothing’s from the city as soon as possible. She has insufficient means to stock up on merchandise and pay for her trip, which is why she is applying for a loan. This is her second loan to develop her business. She is counting on your compassion!

loans.use: to stock up on children's clothing for winter.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a single man. He describes himself as self motivated. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 33 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Gina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: This is Kumba, who lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. Kumba is 33 years old, completed 12th grade, and is married with two children age 12 and 14. Her children live at home and attend school. For the past five years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) selling rice and soup in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband, who works as a driver, and learned this way of selling from her mother. Kumba sells for 12 hours each day in a week. She uses a taxi most of the time to get her stock to her shop. She enjoys the flow of customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish, pepper, oil, onions, vita, rice, meat, etc. to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children and build a house. She appreciates Kiva for its support.

loans.use: to buy more fish, pepper, oil, onions, vita, rice, meat, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 39 years of age and a father of 5 children, four of whom are in school. He is a farmer, mainly in tea growing, which he has done since 2000.  He is a determined farmer who works six days in a week and 10 hours per day on average. His farm is located in Swazi 2-Kyamuhunga – Bushenyi and he says he started farming so that he could have a source of income.  He would like to use the loan funds to buy fertilizer which he hopes to apply on the tea farm land so the soil fertility can be boosted and he gets improved yields. His clients are the tea traders in the area and those from the nearby areas. William says the dry weather/season affects him but believes that with his hard work on the tea farm and income from the poultry business which is his other source of income, he will beat the odds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a married man.  He has 8 children.  He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area conducive to farming, and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that during rain season transportation is a problem. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs. His business goal is to open a store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will meet customer demands. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old married man who has worked as a car mechanic for six years.. He is a hard worker who puts so much effort to keep on improving and developing his business.  Ahmad left school at the Intermediate level to financially support his family.  He didn’t get enough of a chance to enjoy childhood and his education experience, which is a good motive for him to work on planning to provide his future children and beloved family a better living.  Ahmad is working hard on expanding his business and on building a good relationship with his customers.  
He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy special car oils and lubricants in addition to special industrial equipments  to improve his business and to serve more customers in a well-managed way.
In the future, Ahmad is willing to buy more updated industrial equipments and to make necessary maintenance to his work place.

loans.use: to buy special car oils and lubricants in addition to special industrial equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Paulina successfully paid back her previous loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Paulina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a single woman. She has a child who is 6 years old. She describes herself as optimistic.  She is a cook in a boarding school.  She has been involved in this job for 5 years.  She wants to start her own business, and she will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase stock of vegetables, fruits and other items to sell in the grocery store she will start.  She hopes that in the future she will educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase stock of vegetables, fruits and other items

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 29-year-old married man. He has 1 child.  He describes himself as aggressive. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.  He has been involved in this business for 3 years.  His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are daily travelers.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be unfavorable government policies.  He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorbike.  His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years.  This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorbike

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosavilla requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Rosavilla is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 20 years old. He lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his brother and his parents. Khaled is studying for a Bachelor of Communication Engineering in his 2nd year. He is planning to continue his studies to work in his study field after graduation in order to start helping his family financially.  They are currently facing financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a 50-year-old mother from a place called Ragana in Migori county which is located in the Western part of Kenya.  She supports 8 people in her family and is married to Yusto who is a farmer.  Together they are blessed with 5 children who are aged between 25 and 12 years old respectively.

Peres sells green groceries, a business she has been doing for the last 3 years, and gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.  She has requested a third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to add more stock of green grocery. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand the business.

Her dream and hope is to be a successful business lady by maximizing on the little resources she gets.

loans.use: To add more stock of green grocery

loans.name: Wala'

texts.en:
Wala’ is a 27-year-old married mother of two children. She currently has a business weaving and selling embroidered blankets and she has one employee. She started this three years ago, learning her technique in a workshop where she was employed, and later decided to start her own shop.

The youth loan she is currently taking out is to increase her capital in order to buy silk, canvas, and a coffee machine for her clients. She will get these items from a distributor's wholesale. She will then embroider and sell her products at her shop. This allows her to generate income to support her family.
Wala’ is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy silk, canvas, and a coffee machine for her clients.

loans.name: Anoud

texts.en:
Anoud is eighteen years old. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with her six sisters and her parents. Her mother is a teacher. In this, her first year in university Anoud is studying for a Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences.

Anoud’s family is currently facing a financial crisis which makes them unable to pay for her upcoming semester’s tuition. For this reason she is applying for a 377 JOD loan through National Microfinance Bank to cover her university costs and allow her to continue with her studies.

Anoud is planning to continue her studies so she can work in her chosen field after graduation and start helping her family financially.

loans.use: to cover her upcoming university tuition

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a 56-year-old married woman who describes herself as reliable. She has five children ranging in age from 27 to 36 years.

Felista has a farm where for the past eight years she has kept dairy cows whose milk she sells. She says her biggest challenge is a lack of money.

This will be Felista’s first loan with SMEP DTM. She is applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy feed for her cows. Her goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cows

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline is a 29-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from four years to 12 years. She describes herself to be honest and harmless. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes and other groceries. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are both young and old. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of tomatoes, potatoes and other vegetables. Her business goal is to produce her own products to sell within five years. This is her first loan with Kiva partner SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, potatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 26-year-old very hard working gentleman,and newly married. He has been working in the motorcycle transport business for the last one year in Narok town earning a monthly income kes 10,000. He learnt about Kiva partner Kadet from other riders in the town who are already being funded by Kadet Ltd.

Daniel has been advanced with his first loan of kes 91,019 which will facilitate him to acquire his own motorcycle. He is likely to earn more due to the flexibility that comes with ownership and the already established customer base.

He hopes to bring up a successful family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 36-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from four years to ten years. He describes himself to be honest and focused. He operates an electronics shop where he sells radios, batteries, bulbs and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low demand. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to add more stock of electronics to resell. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. This is his second loan with Kiva partner SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add more stock of electronics to resell.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam was born in 1977. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is a retired man. Maryam has been raising goats and selling them and their products for the last four years. She started her project with a small quantity of goats. Then she started increasing their quantity slowly. 

At present, she wants to buy food for her goats to raise their productivity which will lead to raising her sales and income. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so and, for this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food for her goats.

loans.name: Nisexanim
