texts.en: Nisexanim is a 21-year-old woman who studies at the Culture and Art State University. Her years of study are 2011 to 2015 and her faculty is Arts. The family expenses are too high and her father can't pay the university installment for his daughter.  For that she needs a loan of 2,000 azn. This loan will help her to pay the university installment for this semester. This will help her to complete her studies and find a job to help her father with part of the expenses.

loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya and has four children. His highest monthly expenses are those related to his family.

For the past nine years Jonah has been a farmer who derives his income from the milk, eggs and crops he produces on his farm (the animals on his farm have been given no names). As a farmer he most enjoys selling his produce. His biggest challenge is irrigating the farm during the dry season.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jonah has a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any expected change in living standards based on this loan. Jonah has in the household mosquito nets, solar power and running water but does not have electricity, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.

Jonah is applying for a 65,000 KES loan to buy more poultry. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan he replied that the lender targets farmers like him. When also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, he stated that record keeping is the key to success.

Jonah says that this loan will benefit his family by increasing his family’s food supply during all the seasons.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Zahwa

texts.en:
Zahwa was born in 1968. She is a divorced woman who lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Zahwa took a course for hair dressing. That encouraged her to start her project of opening a beauty salon, so she opened one nine years ago. She is planning to open more than one branch in the future at a more active place. 

Now she wants to do some decorations to her salon in order to attract more customers in order to raise her productivity and income. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to do some decorations to her salon to attract more customers.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is 23-years-old and lives at Congo Town in Montserrado County which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. 
She is single with a six-year-old child who lives at home and is in school. She has been selling coal for the past two years now. She started this business with money received from her boyfriend, and she learnt this business from her friends. She spends seven hours each day on her business. Her favorite thing about her business is that it helps to take care of her home. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of coal for her business. In the future, she wants to own a house and a car.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coal for her business.

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en: Yucabeth is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 13 years to 24 years. She describes herself as enterprising. She operates a pharmaceutical store where she sells pharmaceutical products. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area of good potential and her primary customers are general customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan in order to add stock of pharmaceutical products to resell.  Her business goal is to be a distributor of products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. This is her second loan with Kiva partner SMEP DTM and her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of pharmaceutical products to resell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 46-years-old and married with three children.

Elisa is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elisa has been farming rice for 13 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kondiougou 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Noukiatou Oumar debout en cinquième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Ondougou et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 24.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the KONDIOUGOU 6 group are married women who are, on average, 42 years old and also have an average of six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara (fifth administrative region of Mali). 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming activities during the end of this rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution. 

Noukiatou Oumar, a member of the group, essentially grows onions.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, fifth from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

After the harvest, she sells her crops in her village, in Ondougou and Bandiagara, to a customer base which consists of men and women. 

Noukiatou Oumar is expecting to make a profit of 24,000 CFA francs at the end of the farming season.  With this profit, she will be able to help her husband with the family expenses: food, health and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a lady of 35 years, married to John and a mother of three children. She does dairy farming in Limuru and has been in this business for 13 years now. She gets a monthly income of 12,300 shillings.

This will be Grace's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, she wants to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lukiyo

texts.en:
Lukiyo is a 46-year-old man from Homabay, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Millicent, who also owns a small business. He supports 3 people in his family and is blessed with 2 children who are 15 and 13 years old.

Lukiyo has a pharmacy; he has been doing this business for the last 10 years and gets an income of KES 10,000. He is requesting a loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for his children.

His dream is to be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to expand his pharmacy business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 56 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nida has a pottery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Nida has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 35 years old and married with two children who are 7 and 11 years old. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo in the western rural area of Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since the war and sells glass cups, knives and food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is her improper business location.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and food containers for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a child, aged 8, who is in school and lives at home. 

Aminata has been selling rubber dishes, such as pans, plates, spoons, bowls, buckets, etc. for the past 10 years now. She started this business with money from her susu (local saving account) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profits she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pans, plates, spoon, bowls, and buckets for her business. 

In the future, she wants to own a house. She appreciates the support of BRAC and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more pans, plates, spoons, bowls, and buckets for her retail business

loans.name: Aloice

texts.en:
Aloice is a 28-year-old man from Usenge region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports three people in his family and is married to Imelda. He has two children who are three and five years old.

Aloice does fishing as his main economic activity. He has been doing this for the last ten years and gets a monthly income of KES 3,000. He has requested his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase fishing nets. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

His dream is to be able to provide basic needs for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Yeatar E

texts.en: Yeatar is 39 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is unmarried with five children between 7 and 23 years old, who are in school and live at home. She has been selling pepper, oil, rice, etc for the past three years.  She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee and she learns the business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is the interaction with costumers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, etc. for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 19 years old. She lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her brother and her mother. Her father is deceased. Sarah is in her second year of studying for her Bachelor of Urban Planning. She is planning to continue her studies and work in her study field after graduation in order to start helping her mother financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not allowing them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en:
Jartu is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 9, who are in school and live at home. 

Jartu has been selling rice and soup in a shop (restaurant) for 5 years now. She started this business with a loan from a club (group saving account) and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profits she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, fish, oil, charcoal, vita, etc. for her cook shop business. 

In the future, she wants to educate her children and build a house. She appreciates the support of BRAC and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, fish, oil, charcoal, vita, etc. for her cook shop business

loans.name: Al-Hadaia Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Hadaia, which consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. Radhia is a 37-year-old. She has been in the cloth trade business for many years. She is famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Most of her neighbors are her clients. She is making enough to lead a decent life but said her income is not sufficient to bear all of the daily expenditures of her family members alone. She is contributing highly to the family income to support her family through all of her hard work. However, due to low cash in hand, she is facing difficulties in fulfilling the demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense, and perfumes in larger quantities to add to her stocks.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth, incense, and perfumes in larger quantities to add to her stocks.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area that is good for business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fuel and spare parts to service his motorbike. His business goal is to own a taxi within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts to service his motorbike

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
Gorretti is a woman of 61 years, married and a mother of three children who are all adults. She does dairy farming and runs a retail shop in Limuru. She has been in this business for 20 years and gets a monthly income of 15,500 shillings.

This will be Goretti's fourth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy one dairy cow, rice, sugar, cooking oil etc. She wants to build rental houses in future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, sugar, rice and other items

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is from the Vani district where she lives with her husband. She is 25 years old and a young woman with a great desire to get ahead. Nona is the only one making money in the household as her husband is jobless at the moment. 

Nona works as a baker's assistant at the local bakery to earn a living. She also gathers nuts and citrus at the local farmer's fields and even cleans yards on special orders. She works all day long to generate income but her earnings are too small to save and improve their standard of living.

She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices to start a clothing sales business among her community members. Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Nona's business will have high demand. She will be very nice to her customers and will be able to get more profit. This Start up loan is a good chance for Nona to earn a stable income and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Jeraline

texts.en:
Jeraline is 26 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest in Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between three and 18 years old. They are in school and live at home. She has been operating a shop for the past four years now selling coal by the bag. She started this business with the help of her husband, and she learned this business from her mother. 

Her favorite parts about her business is that every day her food can finish on time, and she makes lots of profit. She is requesting this loan to purchase more coal bags for her business. She appreciates all supporters of BRAC Liberia. She promise to pay back her loan on time. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal bags for her business

loans.name: John Gitau

texts.en:
John is a very hardworking man from Olkalou.  He is 45 years old and married to Margaret.  He has three children, ages 16, 9, and 5 years old.  All children are in school. 

John is a farmer, which he has been doing for the last five years.  In order to improve and increase his farm’s productivity, he has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet Ltd.  This loan will help him to buy planting seeds, herbicides, and stocks of charcoal to sell to his customers.

John's income per month is KES 30,000.  He hopes to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay school fees for his children, to repay his loan to Kadet Ltd, and to expand his charcoal business.  His hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful and to help his children become well educated.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and farm inputs, such as seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners.  She has 2 children and has been doing farming for 7 years.  Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.  She also has a personal business in addition to farming. 

She stated that milking is her most enjoyable part about farming and that her biggest challenge is pest control.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Seeroi.'  Lucy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “They train before giving loans”.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, to which she responded “proper record keeping”.  Her highest monthly expense is family expenses.  When asked how the loan would benefit her family, she replied that it would increase the food supply.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Lucy owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.  This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул 46 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает двоих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Жыпаркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жыпаркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаркул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы,16 овец, 1 кобыла. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Jyparkul is a 46 year old widow.  After the death of her husband, she has been both raising two children and running her household.  Jyparkul has a high school education.  Her family's main source of income is raising livestock, which Jyparkul started 19 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 1,000 KGS.  Thanks to the Jyparkul's persistent work, she now has three milking cows, 16 sheep and a horse.  Her monthly income is 8,000 KGS.  

In order to grow her business further, Jyparkul applied to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan to purchase more sheep.  Part of the profits from her business, Jyparkul is planning to re-invest into purchasing additional livestock and save the rest for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara is an experienced farmer from the village Dprapark, in the Gegharquniq region. She lives with her husband and daughter. Tamara's husband works in the private sector. His salary, however, is not enough to cover the basic needs of the family. To be able to meet the family's needs, Tamara is engaged in breeding goats and cultivating corn, potato, grass, and several fruits (plums, pomegranates, figs, blood oranges, apples, pears and walnuts). Farming is an important source of income for the family. Tamara’s daughter helps her greatly in everyday farming activities. Her husband is also very helpful; he sells the agricultural products in the local market. As the family’s needs are increasing day by day, Tamara wants to get more livestock to be able to meet the needs of her family more effectively. A loan of 700 USD will help her greatly, enabling to purchase 7 goats Tamara and her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their support in collecting the needed amount of money for the loan and helping the family sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 7 goats.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 38 years old and married to Benard.  They have two children who are in school.  She has a timber business in Naivasha which she has operated for the past three years.  She applied for the first loan from Kadet to buy more timber to sell.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business and open another timber yard.

In the near future, she hopes to see her family needs well catered and her children to be well educated.

loans.use: to buy timber for sale.

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi is a young gentleman aged 24, who supports his parents. He has been running a motorcycle transport business for the last three years in Narok town, which earns him a monthly income of 10,000 KES in a month. Mwangi learnt about Kadet from other riders in the town who are financed by Kadet Ltd.

He has been advanced his second loan of 30,000 KES after successfully paying off the previous one. He will use the funds to purchase motorcycle parts to repair his broken motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to furnish his house.

He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase new motorcycle parts to repair his broken motorcycle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old, married, and has eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Grace is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportion and hog raising. Gina is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell to customers.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en: Razmik is from the village Hagvi of Lori region. He lives with his wife, school-age daughter (11 years old), his parents and his brother. Razmik works as a driver in the private sector. However, his salary alone is not enough to meet the everyday needs of the family. Razmik, with the help of his family members, is engaged in breeding livestock such as cows, sheep, pigs, piglets, and hens and in the cultivation of alfalfa. Farming is the most important source of income for the family. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Razmik wants to enlarge the livestock to be able to cover the growing needs of his big family. A loan of USD 3,000 will help him reach his goal, enabling Razmik to purchase three cows. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will in helping them sustain and develop their agribusiness

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Meerimgul

texts.ru: Мээримгул 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Мээримгул- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мээримгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мээримгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 лошади, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мээримгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мээримгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома.
texts.en:
Meerimgul is 25 years old, married and together with her husband, she is raising two children.  Meerimgul has a high school education.  The main source of income for her family is raising of livestock, which she started 7 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 4,000 KGS.  Thanks to the Meerimgul's persistent work, she now has one milking cow, two horses and six sheep.  Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.  

In order to expand her business, Meerimgul applied to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase heifers for breeding.  Part of the profits from her business, Meerimgul is planning to re-invest into purchasing additional cattle, and save the rest to eventually purchase a house.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила торгует на привокзальном рынке своего родного города Мелитополя. Она реализует кондитерские изделия в ассортименте. У нее всегда можно найти большое разнообразие самой разной выпечки, печенья и конфет на продажу. 
Сумма в 5 000 гривен нужна Людмиле для того, чтобы закупить партию свежего товара по договору с поставщиками.
texts.en: Ludmila has a shop at a railway market, in her hometown of Melitopol, where she sells an assortments of sweets.  At her stall, one can always find a great variety of pastries, cookies and candies for sale.  Ludmila needs 5,000 hryvni to purchase a fresh batch of goods from her suppliers.

loans.use: to purchase a fresh batch pastries, cookies and candy from her suppliers.

loans.name: Eresmilda

texts.es:
Eresmilda está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en matemáticas, ya que quiere superarse como persona y económicamente para tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Quiere recibirse para poder ejercer su profesión porque me gusta lo que estudia.
Ve una gran oportunidad en esta ayuda, y es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y así seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo para ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Eresmilda is studying mathematics at university since she wishes to advance both economically and as a person in order to have better job opportunities. She wants this loan in order to continue in her profession because she likes what she is studying.

She sees this aid as a great opportunity, and that is why she is requesting this loan. She will invest it in paying her fees, thereby continuing with her studies and becoming a great professional.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is a 54-year-old widowed woman from the Sagarejo district.  She lives with her 23-year-old son, working at a store where construction materials are sold.  His average monthly salary is $180.  Mzia works as a laborer at the local landlord’s fields when she has orders.  Her earnings are seasonal and unstable, which is why she decided to start her own small trading business.  It will be located in a kiosk near the school.   

With the received start-up credit, Mzia will purchase stocks of merchandise, such as chewing gum, sunflower seeds, and various snacks.  Her regular customers will be schoolchildren.  Mzia hopes that her initiative will make a profit for the family's needs.

She is happy for the start-up loans that give poor people the chance to start and develop businesses for improving their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start a small store in a kiosk to sell snacks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old, hard-working lady, married to a farmer, and supports a family of four. Her children are aged between four and twelve years old. She runs a beauty salon and learned about Kadet from one of her regular customers. Mary has been in the salon business for the last three years and earns a  monthly income of 10,000 KES.

She has been advanced her third loan of 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase salon cosmetics including hair oils, weaves, and extensions. She will use the profits to renovate her premise.

Her dream is to expand, and even open another new salon to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase salon cosmetics

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
Volodya is a private entrepreneur from Vanadzor city of Lori region. He lives with his wife, four-year-old son, and his parents. His wife works in the local TV. Volodya runs a furniture production business; he also renovates doors and windows. He and his wife are the only breadwinners of the family and work hard to meet the needs of the family. To be able to continue running his small business in a sustainable way, Volodya needs a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase laminate for furniture production. 

He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during the recent times, Volodya was able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Volodya and his big family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping Volodya to sustain and develop his small business.

loans.use: to purchase laminate for furniture production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 53 years old and lives in Montserrado County which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is a widow with nine children between the ages of 24 and 30.  She has been selling dry fish for the past 25 years now. She says her main challenge is transportation costs. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money, and what makes her proud is that; it enables her to take care of her children and herself. She is requesting this loan to purchase more dry fish to expand her sales.  She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish to expand her sales

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 40 years old, married to Margaret, and they have three children who are in school.

He is in the transport business in Naivasha which he has been running for 12 years, and has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd., to enable him to install electricity in his home. 

He hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet Ltd., to improve his family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase the materials to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is 21 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with his 5 siblings and his parents. His father is a retired man who works as a supervisor manager at a foundation. 

Malek is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Social Sciences and is in his 3rd year. He is planning to continue his studies and work in his field of study after graduation in order to start helping his family financially.  They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing them from paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of 7. Her husband is a retired man who currently works as a driver. 

Basma has been selling home products for 1 year. She started her project by selling small amounts of products. Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of home products to raise her profit and income; this will help her husband in covering their children's needs. She doesn't have enough money to do so, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products to resell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 29-year-old single mother of one child.

She has a kerosene pump in Naivasha which she has operated for the past three years, and has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd., to enable her buy a stock of kerosene. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open another kerosene pump.

In the near future, she hopes to own a petrol station.

loans.use: to buy kerosene for sale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 27-years-old, married to Nicholas, and they have one child.

She has a cosmetic business in Naivasha which she has operated for the past two years, and has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd., to enable her to buy stock of earrings, and necklaces among other items for sale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business, and educate her child.

In the near future, she hopes to open another beauty shop.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, and other items for sale

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир живет в Виноградово. Он – пенсионер. Живет на пенсию и еще подрабатывает в такси диспетчером, так как пенсии не хватает на всё. Владимир всю жизнь был военным, служил миротворцем в других странах. 
Владимиру понадобилась сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать дома ванную комнату. Он хочет использовать полученные от КИВА средства для того, чтобы закупить материал для ремонта и обустроить все в новой ванной, которая находится на территории нового дома, построенного совсем недавно.
texts.en: Vladimir lives in Vinogradovo.  He is retired, lives on his pension and makes additional income by working as a taxi dispatcher, since his pension does not cover all of the necessities.  His entire life Vladimir has been a soldier and served as a peacekeeper in foreign countries.  Vladimir needs 10,000 hryvni to finish his bathroom.  He wants to use the financial means, obtained from KIVA, to purchase building materials for the completion of the bathroom, which is located in his newly built house.

loans.use: to finish the bathroom in his newly built house

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 34-year-old man who is married to Justiner and is a father of 3 children. He runs a retail shop in Kangemi and has been in this business for three years, earning a monthly income of 45,500 shillings.

This will be Thomas's fourth loan with KADET LTD. as he has repaid all other loans successfully. He plans to use the entire amount to buy sugar, rice, flour, and other items for his business. He desires to work to improve his family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, sugar, and other items for the business.

loans.name: Manase

texts.en:
Manase is 63 years old and married to Betty. He is a tailor in Kangemi and has been in this business for 16 years now. He earns a monthly income of 16,000 shillings.

This will be Manase's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for making clothes. In the future, he wants to be prosperous in business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 43 years old, married, and supports a family of seven members. He runs a motorcycle business in Bomet town and its areas. He learned about Kadet Ltd., from other riders who are already being financed by Kadet Ltd. He has been advanced a third loan after successfully paying off the previous ones.

The loan of 30,000 KES, will assist him in repairing his broken motorcycle. He will use the proceeds to diversify in livestock rearing. He hopes to uplift the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a 26 year old shopkeeper, and a single mother to one child. Magdalene has been running her general shop for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 10,500 KES, which she uses to meet her own needs and those of her child. 

Magdalene is applying for her third loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to stock her shop with sugar, stationery, and utensils. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will start a wholesale shop. 

Magdalene hopes and dreams of being a success business person in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, stationery, and utensils for her shop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County that is has the largest Free-port, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is a widow and has three children aged between 24 and 30, and only one lives at home. She has been selling doughnuts and coal for the past 12 years now. She says her main challenge is the high cost of flour and imported oil. She started this business with money given to her by her father, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that she earns a living which enables her to take care of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase more flour, sugar, coal, etc., to enlarge her business.  She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, coal, etc.,  to enlarge her business

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из Мелитополя. Она торгует на крупном местном рынке кожгалантереей и женской обувью. У Ирины есть собственное торговое место. Опыт работы составляет 20 лет. 
Ирине понадобилась сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к осенне-зимнему сезону, а именно приобрести новые модели женских сумок, кошельки, туфли тапочки.
texts.en: Irina is from Melitopol.  She owns a shop at a large market, where she sells women's shoes and leather goods.  She has 20 years of experience in this business.  Irina needs 15,000 hrynvi to purchase new merchandize for the fall and winter seasons.  Specifically, she needs to obtain the latest fashions in purses, wallets and women's shoes.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the fall and winter seasons

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 47 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Arlyn has a rice milling business in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new equipment and gasoline.

Arlyn has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and gasoline

loans.name: Martha W.

texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old and lives Montserrado County, which has the largest port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with five children between 27 and 33 years old. Her children are living on their own. 

She has been selling bread for the past 15 years now.  She started this business with money from her house rent, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes every day, and that she has more customers. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more bread for her business. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia. She promises to pay back her loan on time. In the future, she wants to build another house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 3 years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops, transportation services.  She is employed,and has a personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'profit she gets.' Her biggest challenge is 'drought.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'cross.'

Jane was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'lower interest.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'flexble payment.'

Her highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Jane replied 'improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns the following: 'cow, poultry, automobile' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase poultry for her farm

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария – из Виноградово. Она - замужем, у нее 3 детей. Мария работает на частном предприятии на должности контролёра. Работает уже 3 года. 
Мария необходима сумма в 11 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в ванной комнате, а именно сделать облицовку стен и пола керамической плиткой, установить газовую колонку, сделать монтаж водного насоса и труб, а также приобрести и установить смеситель в ванной. Так как ванна находится в плохом санитарном состоянии, Мария надеется за счет полученных средств улучшить эти условия.
texts.en: Mariya lives in Vinogradovo, she is married and has three children.  Mariya works for a private company as an inspector.  She has been working in this position for three years.  Mariya needs 11,000 hryvni to remodel her bathroom, specifically, to tile the floor and walls, to install a gas heater, to repair the water pump and pipes, and to purchase and install a faucet.  Since her bathroom is currently in a bad state, Mariya is hoping to use the loan to improve this condition.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Esperanza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Esperanza has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old and lives in the town of Makidye in the Kampala, south region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as sugar and water, for the shop to sell. It will help Christine generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a larger retail shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as sugar and water, for the shop to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cherry has a Nito weaving business in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her Nito weaving.

Cherry has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her Nito (native palm) weaving.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 39 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest port (Freeport) and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 18 years old.  Her children are in school and live at home. 

Since 1999 Patricia has been selling charcoal in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  She spends nine hours each day on her business and she is good at managing it.  Patricia is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.  She appreciates the support of BRAC and promises to payback her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old and is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eva has a nito-weaving business in the Philippines. Eva requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nito-weaving.

Eva has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nito-weaving.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 33 years old and married with two children.

Candelaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell to customers.

Candelaria has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Candelaria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 50 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.

She is married with 7 children between 12 to 20, who attend school and  live at home. She has been selling under clothes in the local market for the past 2 years now. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her husband. 

Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more under clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to build house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more under clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 40 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala, south region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Sam has been working hard to manage his timber business, which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber to sell, which will help Sam generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Sam hopes that in the future, he will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Sam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Sam, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell.

loans.name: Pascol

texts.en:
Pascol is 30 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala, south region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 8 years, Pascol has been working hard to manage his bar shop, which sells drinks, such as soda, beer. 

To help expand his business, Pascol has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks, such as soda and beer, to sell, which will help Pascol generate greater profits, and pay school fees for his children. Pascol hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business into a whole sell shop. 

Pascol is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pascol who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, such as soda and beer, to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town.  She is married with six children between the ages of 2 and 18.  Five of her children are in school and all of them live at home. 

For the past eight years Ruth has been selling slippers.  She started this business with money given to her by her brother.  Her favorite part about her business is that she makes a profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business.  In the future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 34 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Arlyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay is 35 years old and lives at Congo town in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children who are 7 and 13 years old. They live at home and attend school. For the past years, she has been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business makes her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Mbalu is 40 years old and is from the Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone.  She is married with four children ages 11 to  20 years old.  Three of her children are currently attending school.  

Mbalu runs a food stand within her community and sells rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.  She has been running this business since 1985.  She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day.  She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operating area. 

Mbalu has requested a loan in order to buy, rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family.  In the future, she plans to expand her business.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 42 years old and married with six children between the ages of 2 years and 21 years. She runs a clothing business in the northern area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for five years and sells wax cotton and baby clothes. She says that the main challenge to her business is slow purchasing power during the rainy season.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her children and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale.

loans.name: Ramatta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Ramatta from Lunsar, Northern area. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 year and 15 years. She began this business to create a source of income.   

Ramatta runs a food stock business at her house; she sells palm oil, rice and pepper. She has been running this business for the past 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week. Ramatta says that her major problem is the poor road network.

Ramatta has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, rice and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and   become an international businesswoman. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice and pepper.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 7 and 14 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. She has been selling rice, oil, pepper, etc for the past six years. She started this business with money from her susu (daily saving account). She learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she makes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Nenia

texts.en:
Nenia is 42 years old and married with one kid.

Nenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from clothing sales.

Nenia aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fea

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Fea from Lunsar, Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 years and 13 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.  

Fea runs a business selling building material within her community. She sells cement, paint and zinc. She has been running this business since she was a young age. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. 

Fea has requested a loan in order to buy cement, paint and zinc to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint and zinc to sell.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is 32 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with a three-year-old who attends school and lives at home. She has been selling coal for the past six years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business,

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Aminata from Lunsar from the Northern area. She is married with seven children between the ages of 5 years and 25 years. She did not go to school and she got married at an early age.   

Aminata runs a business selling cosmetic items within a busy market area. She sells cream, earrings, chains and bracelets. She has been running this business for the past ten years. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Aminata says that at present her business is doing well.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy cream, earrings, chains and bracelets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cream, earrings, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is 46 years old and married with four children.

Maria Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria Lourdes has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Maria Lourdes aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mamadie

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mamadie from Port Loko, Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Two of her children are currently attending school.  She started this business to improve herself and her family.

Mamadie runs a business selling spare parts within her community. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. 

Mamadie has requested a loan in order to buy radiators, brake oil, chains and engines. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she would like to see her business grow rapidly. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy radiators, brake oil, chains and engines.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima está separada, no tiene hijos dependientes y vive en una casa donde cancela un alquiler mensual. La casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primaria. Ella es empleada del sector area verde del municipio de El Alto pero en sus ratos libres se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de mantas
El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital para poder comprar por cantidad (lana de diferentes marcas y colores) y asi tener a disposicion para poder cumplir con el requerimiento.
El sueño de Maxima es  tener una tienda donde puedan exponerse sus diferentes trabajos a nivel nacional y asi tener mejor calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Maxima is separated, has no dependent children, and lives in a house where she pays a monthly rent.  Her house is located in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto.  She only ever attended elementary school.  Maxima is a park employee for the city of El Alto but in her free time she makes and sells blankets.  She needs a loan to increase her capital so she can buy bulk amounts of wool in various styles and colors to have on hand so she can fill requirements.  Maxima’s dream is to have a shop where she can display her work nationally, which would enable her to have a higher quality of life.  This is the second time Maxima has requested a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wool in various colors and styles for her small business making blankets

loans.name: Moine

texts.en: Moine is 28 years old, and live in the Montserrado County which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 3 and 10 years old, who live at home and attends school. She is a tenth grade drop-out. She described herself as very hard working woman. For the past ten years she has been operating a business where she sells cow skins at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband who is a local businessman. She enjoys her business because it gives her more money.  She sells for six days in a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses a bus to get her goods to the table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cow skins for the business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cow skin for her business.

loans.name: Sundayway

texts.en: This is Sundayway again.  She is now 42 years of age and still lives in the Congo Town community. She is married with three children between the ages of 11 and 16. They live at home with their mother; only two of the children are attending school. She stopped her education in the 5th grade, and her husband is a contractor. She has been very hardworking and determined with her business for the past seven years. She sells (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, blouses, and head ties. Because of the quality materials that she sells, she makes a profit every day. She sells for 12 hours a day. She purchases her goods from wholesale dealers, and transports them by a commercial vehicle. She is requesting her fifth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, and blouses for the business. She is grateful to all the lenders for the support they have given her in her business. Her dream is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, and blouses for the business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es un buen estudiante que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo pretende terminar este año la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas y su meta como todo estudiante de Derecho es hacer que se cumpla la justicia, con este rol llegar a una buena o mejor situación económica, y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad y así poder seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Joel is a good student who plans to finish his law degree this year through much sacrifice and effort.  His goal, like any other law student is to make sure justice is done.  He also wants to improve his economic situation and help his family.

He is requesting a loan to pay for university costs so he can continue studying until he reaches his goal.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Nieves is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.  Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Nema 2 Group

texts.fr: LE BANC VILLAGEOIS DE NEMA 2 A ÉTÉ INAUGURE LE 24 MARS 2001. LA REPRÉSENTE MADAME CÉCILE, DIVORCEE ET MÈRE DE 4 ENFANTS EST MEMBRE DU GROUPE DE SOLIDARITÉ NOMME NGHATAMANE QUI SIGNIFIE S'ENTRE AIDER, TRAVAILLER POUR RÉUSSIR. ET LES MEMBRES DE CE GROUPE ONT CETTE MÊME VOCATION RÉUSSIR DANS LEURS ACTIVITÉS ET ELLES REMBOURSENT LEURS PRÊTS SANS DIFFICULTÉS. MADAME CÉCILE EST AGE DE 57 ANS ET ELLE S'EXERCE COMME ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPALE LE COMMERCE DES LÉGUMES COMME VENTE DE CAROTTES , CHOUX, TOMATE... ELLE S'APPROVISIONNE A DAKAR ET ELLE MENÉ CETTE ACTIVITÉ DEPUIS PLUS DE 13 ANS. SES BÉNÉFICES LUI SERVENT LE PAIEMENT DE SA LOCATION, L'EAU, ÉLECTRICITÉ, LA NOURRITURE ETC... MAIS ELLE A ÉGALEMENT OUVERT UN COMPTE POUR DE L’ÉPARGNE.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" Nema 2 was founded on 24th March 2001.  Madame Cécile is the representative for the Nghatamane Group.  The group's name means 'to help one another, to work for success'.  

Madame Cécile is 57 years old, a divorcée and mother to 4 children.  All the members of the Nghatamane group have the same aim, to be successful with their businesses.  They have always repaid their loans without any problems.  Madame Cécile's principal business is the sale of vegetables such as carrots, cabbages and tomatoes.  She buys her stocks in Dakar and she has operated this business for more than 13 years.  Her earnings pay for her rent, water, electricity, food, etc.  She also has a savings account.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Isatu from Port Loko. She is married with 6 children. She began her food market because she was trained in this business.

Isatu sells various items from a room in her house; she sells cigarettes, milk, pure water and other drinks. She has been running this business since 2000. Because the business is located in her home, she works all day, everyday.  Isatu says that at present her business is doing fine.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, bagged milk and various drinks. The extra income produced from this loan will allow her to expand her business and take care of her family's needs. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, bagged milk and drinks to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 21 years old, and lives in the Montserrado County which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a five-year-old old child who is in school and lives at home. She has completed the 12th grade and has had a business for the past 3 years selling used clothes in the local market to make some money. She  started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend, who is a local businessman. She enjoys her business because it give her more money.  She sells for six days in a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she catches the bus to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and own a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Minever M.

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Minever M. from Liberia. She operates a shop selling charcoal in the Congo Town area of Liberia.  It is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable living, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. Minever M. is married with two children aged 14 and 20 years old. She is a high school graduate. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in the local market.  She started the business with money given to her by her mother.  She enjoys her business because it gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 6pm, and most of the time she uses a shared-taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Fanta from Port Loko. She is married with 3 children. Two of her children are currently attending school. she was a housewife but she began her shoe business because she wanted to contribute to paying the household expenses.  

Fanta runs a shoe shop where she sells shoes and slippers. She has been running this business since 1999. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. 

Fanta has requested a loan in order to buy shoes and slippers to sell. The extra income that this loan will generate will allow her to pay to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she would like to see her business grow rapidly. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Kamboinse Bonswende Group

texts.fr:
Mme YAMBA dite FATIMATA représente le groupe KAMBOINSE BONSWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a27ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des produits de beauté depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Sankar yaar. Ses clients sont les femmes et les jeunes filles.
Elle veut s’acheter 30paquets de mèches, 60boites de pommades et 03douzaines de boucles.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique, mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yamba, who is known as Fatimata, is the leader of the Kamboinse Bonswende group. She is married with six children. The oldest is 27 and the youngest seven. Two of them go to school. She has three people who are dependent on her.
Mrs. Yamba has been selling beauty products for eight years. She buys her stock in Sankar Yaar. Her customers are women and young girls.
She would like to buy 30 packets of locks of hair, 60 packets of cream, and three dozen ringlets.
She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. She hopes to open a bigger shop and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 30 packets of locks of hair, 60 boxes of cream and three dozen ringlets.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 49 years old, and lives in Montserrado County. She is married with a one year old child. She is a high school graduate and for the past 5 years she has been selling used clothes at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Victoria is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to sell, and in the future her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 33 years old, and lives in Montserrado County. She is  married and has three children aged between 2 and 10,  only the two oldest children are in school and they all live at home. She has not completed the 5th grade, but she manages her business well. For the past five years, she has been selling slippers and body-cream at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, she enjoys interacting with her customers. She works six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses the bus to get her stock to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and body-cream for her business. Her plans are to build a house and pay for education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and body-cream for her business.

loans.name: Gnambossou Gbeta 3 Group

texts.fr: GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 3 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ivette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans. Ivette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Ivette est mariée à un certain Idris. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ivette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Ivette vend des vivres ( riz et pâtes alimentaires) et divers produits à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution depuis dix ans. Ivette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ivette s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 3 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Gnambossou Gbeta 3 is a group composed of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The leader of the group who is called Ivette (with her hand raised in the photo) is 41 years old. Ivette did not go to school. She is married to a man named Idris. They have three children, some of whom attend school at their expense. Ivette lives with her husband and their children. They share the family expenses. In order to provide for her family, Ivette has been selling food (rice, pasta) and various products from home and by delivery for ten years. Ivette buys her stock at the market in Benin. Hoping to reinforce her business, Ivette joins the other members of Gnambossou Gbeta 3 to request a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To buy food (rice, pasta) and various products.

loans.name: Baasneere Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SOULEYMANE est le responsable du groupe BAASNEERE. Marié, il est  père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mr est gérant de boutique depuis 03ans.  Il s’approvisionne dans un grand  marché de la place. Ses clients sont les voisins.
Il veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz et 03bidons de d’huile de 20l pour revendre.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir sa boutique. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Souleymane is the representative of the Baasneere Group.  He is married and has 2 children.  The oldest child is 7 years old, and the youngest is 4 years old.  One of the children goes to school and Souleymane is financially responsible for 3 people.  

Souleymane has run a shop for 3 years.  He buys his supplies in a large, local market.  His customers are his neighbours.  Souleymane will use this loan to buy 2 sacks of rice and 3 20-litre-barrels of oil for resale.  His earnings will be used to increase the size of his shop.  

In the future, he would like to be able to afford to send both his children to school.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice and 3 20-litre-barrels of oil for resale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un campesino de 38 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos. Desde muy joven aprendió todas las labores del campo y, hace 6 años es propietario de cultivos de café, ganado bovino y porcino, para lo cual posee muy buena infraestructura en una pequeña finca donde vive con su familia. Se caracteriza por su pujanza y su gran amor al trabajo, que desarrolla durante todos los días de la semana desde las primeras horas de la mañana, pues de esa manera genera los recursos económicos con los que ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de 9 salas de gestación para las cerdas, lo que le permitirá ampliar su ciclo productivo, lo que permitirá que su producción aumente y así satisfacer la demanda de lechones que se incrementa en la temporada navideña que se aproxima. Todo esto se reflejará en los buenos resultados de su negocio y afectará positivamente la economía de la familia, lo que ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar.
texts.en:
Juan is a 38-year-old farmer who is married and has three children.  He learned about farming when he was very young and six years ago he began growing coffee and raising sheep cattle and pigs.  He has a very good infrastructure set up on his small farm where he lives with his family.  He is known for his strength and love of work which he does every day of the week from the early morning hours.  This allows him to generate enough economic resources to support his family.

Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy nine gestation pens for his pigs so he can increase production and meet the demand for suckling pigs for the Christmas season.  This will make his business more profitable, having a positive effect on the family economy and lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy nine pig gestation pens to increase production.

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 2 Group

texts.fr: GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 2 est un groupe composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Koudiratou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Koudiratou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Koudiratou est mariée à un certain Gibril. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Koudiratou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Koudiratou vend depuis vingt ans des chaussures, des tissus et des mèches par la méthode de distribution. Koudiratou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Koudiratou s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 2 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gnambossou-Gbeta 2 is a group which is made up of 2 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Koudiratou (the one with her hand raised in the picture) is 42 years old. Koudiratou did not go to school. She is married to Gibril. The couple have 3 dependent children who all attend school. Koudiratou lives with her husband and their children. The couple both cover the family's various expenses.

In order to be able to fulfill her family's needs, Koudiratou has been selling shoes, fabrics and hair extensions for 20 years, via the distribution channel. Koudiratou gets her supplies at markets in Benin and Togo. Koudiratou joins the other member of the Gnambossou-Gbeta 2 group in requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé, with the aim of strengthening her business. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes, fabrics and hair extensions.

loans.name: Annick's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Annick (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Annick n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Annick est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Annick  vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Annick et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. C'est pour cette raison que dame, Annick vend depuis dix ans du maïs et divers produits (savons, sucre, biscuits)à son domicile. Annick s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Annick s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Annick (with her hand raised in the photo), who is 29 years old.  Annick did not go to school.  She is married to Pierre, and they have three children who all attend school.  Annick and her  husband are financially responsible for their children, and they all live together.  Between them, Annick and Pierre pay for all the expenses of their household.
